thread.title: CWC JV routs Hamilton County

title: CWC JV routs Hamilton County
text: CWC JV routs Hamilton County Comment The Carmi Times - Carmi, IL Writer Posted Oct. 13, 2015 at 8:00 AM Updated at 8:46 AM Posted Oct. 13, 2015 at 8:00 AM Updated at 8:46 AM MCLEANSBORO – The Hamilton County Foxes scored on the first play of the game but the CWC Bulldogs controlled the action from that point on in a 42-6 win in JV football on Monday afternoon. The Bulldogs fumbled in the end zone on the opening kickoff and it was recovered by Hamilton County for their only points of the game. After the next kickoff, CWC scored on their first play from scrimmage on a long run from Colton Yates. The Bulldogs’ offense moved the ball well all day with Yates and Wyatt Weinbrecht each rushing for over 100 yards. Quarterback Justin Lamp also spread the ball to several receivers throughout the contest. Coach Clinton Wolff’s comments –“We had some mental errors early, but this is a good group of sophomores and we fought back. Our offensive line played especially well today.” CWC scoring plays:
